(a) This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the global space industry generates annual revenues exceeding $1 trillion for the calendar year 2027, as reported by a reputable source such as the Space Foundation or Morgan Stanley. The revenue figure must be based on official annual reports.

(b) This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the Democratic Party gains a majority in the US House of Representatives following the 2026 midterm elections. The majority status must be officially confirmed by the Clerk of the House. The resolution date for this question is January 1, 2028.

not_P.body:
(a) This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the global space industry does not generate annual revenues exceeding $1 trillion for the calendar year 2027, as reported by a reputable source such as the Space Foundation or Morgan Stanley. The revenue figure must be based on official annual reports.

(b) This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the Democratic Party does not gain a majority in the US House of Representatives following the 2026 midterm elections. The majority status must be officially confirmed by the Clerk of the House. The resolution date for this question is January 1, 2028.

(a) This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Switzerland's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita, as reported by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF), exceeds $100,000 at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The GDP per capita figure must be verifiable through the official statistics of the World Bank or IMF.

(b) This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Virginia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) grows by more than 15% between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The GDP growth must be confirmed by official data from the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis or a similar reputable source.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Switzerland's GDP per capita does not exceed $100,000 by January 1, 2028, nor (b) Virginia's GDP does not grow by more than 15% between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028?

The GDP per capita figure must be verifiable through the official statistics of the World Bank or IMF.

(b) This question will be resolved as 'No' if Virginia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) does not grow by more than 15% between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The GDP growth must be confirmed by official data from the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis or a similar reputable source.
